subject: RE: [junit] test with in
msgSnippet: All things are possible, but not all things are advisable. While I think that there is fairly wide agreement that JavaDoc in the source file is good, I would
messageBody:
All things are possible, but not all things are advisable. While I think that there is fairly wide agreement that JavaDoc in the source file is good, I would suggest that tests inside the source file are not.

To my mind, there is a valuable separation when you have the tests in a separate file. Each file is able to be specific and short. The actual object being tested can just get on with doing it's purpose in life and the test can concentrate on driving it hard. Also, remember that a test is against a behaviour rather than a method, so some tests may have legitimate reasons to test methods from several objects as part of testing a behaviour.

Hope this helps.

Simon
